A4: I do this by getting the Ss up and moving in the CR. Taking them outside in a couple days! High Schoolers need this also!
@alilynnp yes! Use iMovie a lot, freshmen are creating an informercial tom. Can't wait to see finished product.
@alilynnp we have iPads, which were a nightmare last year w/games, this year better. I am denied apps I wants, but use others for projects.
@alilynnp I meant "research, yes."
@alilynnp my HS kiddos use it for answers all the time. Not the right use. Research Ed, but to always have an answer w/o thinking is bad.
@alilynnp @mrvesco @JaneCulver5 don't know how this got that I am against tech, never said. Use it a lot in my CR.
FYI: I am not against tech. I use it a lot in my CR to build creativity and foster imagination, but my HS kiddos use it wrong. #ksedchat
@alilynnp @mrvesco @JaneCulver5 I don't know, my Ss have a hard time writing a narrative. They want someone to give them the answers.
@alilynnp @mrvesco @JaneCulver5 not all tech is bad on creativity, Ss have less of an imagination when tech tells them the answers.
@karalu79 agreed, but not always easy! Google or Siri seem to have all the answers anymore. Not always the right answer. : )
A2: I have Ss draw pictures, go outside and create poems, work in groups to create iMovies. #ksedchat
@mrvesco @JaneCulver5 agreed! Now if they have an app to do a story in (which is not available to my Ss) they they can be very creative!
@karalu79 Yes, tech can show creativity, but also stifles the real thinking process. Kids are too quick to Google search answers.
@mrvesco yes, but also does not lead to thinking on our own with Google search. Narratives are hard for my kids.
@lovinafarmboy Yes! With the idea that failure is OK and that learning from it is key!
A1: It can be taught, but you have to have an open mind to new ideas. Imagination is hard these days with tech. #ksedchat
